title: Aural - bass clef rhythm, three-four time

content.description: Identify the rhythm. You will have ten seconds to read the choices carefully before the example is played. You will hear the example played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Listen to the music and identify the rhythm that matches the example played.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Four measures of a melody in three-four. The rhythms are half note, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth rest, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth with a tie, eighth, eighth, quarter, dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted half note.

Four measures of a melody in three-four. The rhythms are half note, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth rest, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth with a tie, quarter, eighth, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted half note.

Four measures of a melody in three-four. The rhythms are dotted quarter, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth rest, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth with a tie, eighth, eighth, quarter, dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted half note.

Four measures of a melody in three-four. The rhythms are dotted quarter, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth rest, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth with a tie, quarter, eighth, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted half note.

content.answer: Four measures of a melody in three-four. The rhythms are dotted quarter, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth rest, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, eighth with a tie, eighth, eighth, quarter, dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted half note.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
